reviews.review_msg: I wish I had known about proffesor Dawson before. I just found out he's the director of our history department but still had time to teach our little class. Kind and liberal with grading. Appreciates you asking questions and showing interest in course. Doesn't dock late marks off assignments which is awesome but can make you procrastinate. Go Alec!

If you like discussions you'll love his classes. He only lectures for the first half and then opens it up to the class. It's a really open space and Dawson has a nack for letting things tangent then bringing them back. Relaxed, funny and genuinely inspiring and critical perspectives. Dawson is a must take prof!

Professor Dawson takes a unique and engaging approach to Latin American history. He is very knowledgeable and passionate about the topics we cover in the course. Ask in person for extensive feedback on your essays and how to strengthen your writing, he is very approachable and genuinely wants you to do well. One of the best professors at SFU!

Alec is a fantastic professor. He forces students to think critically about issues of race, class, gender and history and to reflect on their own assumptions in class. His ideas are engaging, sometimes controversial, and always make for an interesting class discussion.   Do your readings and participate and you will do well!

Fantastic prof. Approaches the teaching of history in a whole new way. Extremely helpful and present. He is dedicated and passionate about his work and teaching. Loads of reading but so worth the discussions with him. One of my most favorite profs yet. He is genuine and empathetic and challenges his class to not make generalizations about anything.

Alex is by far one of the most outstanding professor's I've taken a class with at SFU.  He's an experienced teacher who knows how to guide a class that relies mostly on thought processes & discussion.   He's well versed with past & current issues facing Latin America & has a broader perspective of understanding history itself.  A very kind man.

Alec is the dean of our department so I was surprised he took the time out to teach a tiny class of undergrads. He really cares about you and classes are more of a conversation than a lecture. Great feedback on written work. I learned so much just from talking with him and about how to look at how we learn. Very insightful and unique class.

Professor Dawson is awesome! great lecturer always interesting and shows great interest in the subject matter.  His book is well written as well.  He has to cover an immense topic in this class that is why he sometimes seems to be all over the place.

Lectures were a little all over the place, he focuses on the larger themes in history. It is an essay based course and there is quite a bit of reading- a whole book a week usually. It was an interesting course though, you do learn some pretty cool stuff. Make sure to do the essays early in the term instead of leaving it to the last couple classes.

Really essay based course for me. Found him an easier marker than the TA. Fair marker. Lectures were moderately useless, he loved to talk about "themes" and stuff in history, and the marking was pretty much all based on various essays.

dawson teaches good topics and really opens up your views of latin america. however, his lectures are all over the place, you need to rely heavily on the text for information. also try and take the 208 course because he assumes you have when he is lecturing.
he is all over the place and does not have a clear structure of teaching. I feel I could have learned a lot more. However, he teaches history differently, and opens new perspectives.
Fantastic prof, makes you see history in a holistic manor. One of the best profs of SFU by far.

This guy is a good prof, 3 essays + tutorials make 70% of your grade, so if you're good at writing then you'll do good. Marking is up to the T.A. not him. Lecture was very interesting however if you spent time doing the essays thats your grade. Final review session covered topics on final, final was also an essay!!! -_-, writing course!.
Best teacher Ive had at SFU

1) Needs to relax a bit on the grading 2) Has to understand that other people have different opinions to his own 3) Could write some comments on work that he has graded 4) Has to cut back on the number of novels he assigns students to read. This is not an english class 5) I do like the fact that he did not use a textbook

Grading is a little on the hard side. It's good he just does not teach out of a textbook, but he makes you by 6 of the most boarding novels I have ever read. His lectures manage to keep the class awake, but the tutorials are easy to sleep through.

Prof. Dawson is the model of the P.C social historians that drive me nuts at SFU. He knows his stuff, and he's interested in it. However, you'll spend more time discussing gender roles then you'll spend actually discussing Latin American history. Plus don't try to bring any pol/military history up, because apparently it isn't relevant.
Wow! Super guy who loves Latin America. Has lots of stories about Mexico. Fair Marker! Highly recommended.

Really interesting course. Prof is extremely knowledgeble about the material. Can be a bit intimidating because when you give an answer he wants to know why you answer the way you do. Well prepared for tutorial.

Very good prof.  Really interested in material.  Course was decent, but I wish he could have given us a textbook for basic reference stuff since most people in the class knew very little of Latin America.  He concentrates on pictures/monographs a lot - but he does convey a good message, coherent, and gives his own EXCELLENT insight.
GREAT PROFESSOR!! Interesting, funny, fair marker... Christ, the guy even had a study group before the final in which we went over the essay questions!!!

Great prof, very interesting course.  He really tries to draw out some new ideas, for me it was great, different from the generic view of history.  I recommended 100 percent.  Although, be prepared for aggresive tutorials, don't worry it's defintely worth it.
Made history really interesting by focusing on themes and individual stories.  Also managed to fit in a lot of issues about the production of history.  Plus there was a whole week about pirates!

He was interesting and I liked him. However, some people in the class disagreed with me. Well in tutorials, he was always scratching his......... uh...... you know what I mean. Well didn't notice that myself until somebody told me. Would like to take another class with him though. Strong obsession for Donald Duck and the Gaucho

Interesting material! He demands too much on discussion papers - tells you your work is too "simple." If you ask how he wants you to write, he'll tell you to write like NY Journalists(?). Has strong opinions and in class attacks you if you disagree with him. Wont stop until he wins.

Lectures did tend to be a little bit boring. He was, however, very clear about what he wanted from exams. Very helpful in office hours, and very helpful with study tutorials for final exam. Interesting Prof, likes papers to have a twist to them.

Very opinionated!  Demands too much on discussion papers, ie very hard marker.  Lectures are interesting but readings are boring.  Will not accept anybody's opinion other than his own.  Says he is an expert and a professional but he should take manner lessons.
Harsh marker, but a good prof all around.  Interesting content in lectures, but he really drones them out...making you want to nap...

super nice prof.- he is extremely helpful in getting you to understand his materials and assignments.  very good at lecturing- looked forward to his classes- we also commend him for teaching when sick all semester! thumbs up!

Boring class for such an interesting topic! He is very opinionated and will not like it if you disagree in your discussion papers! Boring readings for the most part, they barely even need to get done! Do not recommend this class!
Demands too much on discussion papers but has a new and interesting approach to teaching
Very postmodern... :(   Will dismiss your work saying that it is "simplistic".  Will tell you there are many ways to interpret an issue, but his is right!
Very helpful and generous with his time during office hours
a lot of readings, but very interesting lectures
Interesting lecutures. Very Fair exams, but expects way too in your papers. Likes ridiculous facts. Strange guy.
No Comments
He is always sick, yet toughs it out, so give him points for that.  Presents Latin American history from a very balanced viewpoint.
No Comments
